value.title: Best Practices for Power BI modelling
value.excerpt: Ok, time for another Power Bi video and this time we are going to talk about Power BI naming conventions and other power bi modelling tips. value.title: COVID Vaccine Tracker Part1: Get data from github and schedule refresh it

In Part 1 we will get the data from Github, publish it to a PPU workspace (we will need that later) and show you how to schedule refresh it and what to do if the option is not available. value.title: Create a bump or slope chart in Power BI
value.excerpt: Bump or slope charts are useful to sport changes between categories. There is no native bump or slope visual in Power BI, but you can create your own easily from a line chart. In this video I show you how. #curbal #power bi #bumpcharts  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX Fridays! #11: Using variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables are an extremely useful feature in DAX, but perhaps not a well known one. Variables, 1. Make your formulas more readable 2. You can reuse them through your report 3. Can also be tables 4. Are more efficient  Download our Growth dashboard if you want to see the example live:http://curbal.com/blog/the-ultimate-dashboard-to-track-your-website-growth-with-google-analytics-and-power-bi-supercharged-excel
